notable_quotes.french: que ladicte pouldre ne peult poinct faire de mal aux sorcieres qui la manient et que quand ils ont jecté de ladite pouldre sur quelque personne ou bestial, c'est le diable leur maitre par apres qui les faict mourir
notable_quotes.english: that the said powder cannot do harm to the witches who handle it and that when they have thrown the said powder on any person or animal, it is the devil their master afterwards who makes them die

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean fils Demenge Claude Martin
notable_quotes.french: que luy ny toutes aultres sorcieres, n'ont poinct de puissance sur aulcune personne que le diable ne les en advertisse premierement, leur commandans de ce faire apres neangtmoings qu'ilz ont eu l'envie et intention de mal faire a aulcune personne, et que touttes les personnes et bestial qu'il a faict mourir, le diable son maitre Persin, l'avoit tousjours poussé et incité de ce faire
notable_quotes.english: that he nor any other witches have any power over any person unless the devil first informs them of it, commanding them to do so after they have had the desire and intention to harm any person, and that all the persons and animals he has killed, the devil his master Persin had always pushed and incited him to do so

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an unusual trial of a very young male accused (16-17 years old) whose mother was simultaneously on trial for witchcraft. The case shows significant judicial caution with the Change de Nancy restricting torture to thumbscrews only with moderation. Notable for the accused's initial resistance to confession, retraction under torture, and the pattern of alleged malefices all stemming from childhood quarrels and insults. The trial reveals military presence in the region and provides detailed demonological testimony about the mechanics of malefic powder and devil's power over witches.
